mechanics.condition: Target is up to ten centipedes, three spiders, five wasps, or one scorpion AND within range (30ft)
mechanics.outcome: Target transforms into its giant version (Giant Centipede, Giant Spider, Giant Wasp, Giant Scorpion) for the duration
Transformed creatures obey your verbal commands and act on your turn in combat

mechanics.condition: Transformed creature drops to 0 hit points

mechanics.outcome: You dismiss the effect on one transformed creature, ending its transformation
Transformation ends for all affected creatures

mechanics.condition: A creature not explicitly listed as a target (centipede, spider, wasp, scorpion) is chosen

description_text: You transform up to ten centipedes, three spiders, five wasps, or one scorpion within range into giant versions of their natural forms for the duration. A centipede becomes a giant centipede, a spider becomes a giant spider, a wasp becomes a giant wasp, and a scorpion becomes a giant scorpion. Each creature obeys your verbal commands, and in combat, they act on your turn each round. The GM has the statistics for these creatures and resolves their actions and movement. A creature remains in its giant size for the duration, until it drops to 0 hit points, or until you use an action to dismiss the effect on it. The GM might allow you to choose different targets. For example, if you transform a bee, its giant version might have the same statistics as a giant wasp.
